translations.english_saheeh: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the winds (or angels or the Messengers of Allâh) sent forth one after another.
translations.english_rwwad: By those [winds] sent forth in succession,

translations.english_saheeh: And the winds that blow violently
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the winds that blow violently.
translations.english_rwwad: those that blow violently,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the winds that scatter clouds and rain.
translations.english_rwwad: and scatter [rainclouds] far and wide,

translations.english_saheeh: And those [angels] who bring criterion[1816]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the Verses (of the Qur’ân) that separate the right from the wrong.
translations.english_rwwad: And by those [angels] who bring criterion;

translations.english_saheeh: And those [angels] who deliver a message.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the angels that bring the revelations to the Messengers,
translations.english_rwwad: and those who deliver revelation,

translations.english_saheeh: As justification or warning,
translations.english_hilali_khan: To cut off all excuses or to warn.
translations.english_rwwad: leaving no excuse or giving warning –

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Surely, what you are promised must come to pass.
translations.english_rwwad: what you are promised will surely come to pass.

translations.english_saheeh: So when the stars are obliterated
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then when the stars lose their lights.
translations.english_rwwad: So when the stars are extinguished,

translations.english_saheeh: And when the heaven is opened
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the heaven is cleft asunder.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the sky is split apart,

translations.english_saheeh: And when the mountains are blown away
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the mountains are blown away.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the mountains are blown away,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1817]- i.e., when they are gathered to witness concerning their nations.  The sentence's conclusion is understood to be "...the promised judgement will then take place."

translations.english_saheeh: And when the messengers' time has come...[1817]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the Messengers are gathered to their time appointed.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the messengers are summoned,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1818]- "It" may refer to either the aforementioned occurrences collectively or to the testimony of the messengers.

translations.english_saheeh: For what Day was it postponed?[1818]
translations.english_hilali_khan: For what Day are these signs postponed?
translations.english_rwwad: until which Day has all this been postponed?

translations.english_saheeh: For the Day of Judgement.
translations.english_hilali_khan: For the Day of Sorting Out (the men of Paradise from the men destined for Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: Until the Day of Judgment.

translations.english_saheeh: And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And what will explain to you what is the Day of Sorting Out?
translations.english_rwwad: How do you know what the Day of Judgment is?

translations.english_saheeh: Woe,[1819] that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: Did We not destroy the former peoples?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Did We not destroy the ancients?
translations.english_rwwad: Did We not destroy the earlier nations?

translations.english_saheeh: Then We will follow them with the later ones.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So shall We make later generations to follow them.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We will do likewise to the later ones.

translations.english_saheeh: Thus do We deal with the criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thus do We deal with the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We deal with the wicked.

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Did We not create you from a despised water (semen)?
translations.english_rwwad: Did We not create you from a worthless fluid,

translations.english_saheeh: And We placed it in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We placed it in a place of safety (womb),
translations.english_rwwad: then We placed it in a secure repository

translations.english_saheeh: For a known extent.
translations.english_hilali_khan: For a known period (determined by gestation)?
translations.english_rwwad: for a determined period?

translations.english_saheeh: And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We did measure; and We are the Best to measure (the things).
translations.english_rwwad: For We determined it; How excellently We determine!

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: Have We not made the earth a container
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have We not made the earth a receptacle
translations.english_rwwad: Have We not made the earth a receptacle

translations.english_saheeh: Of the living and the dead?
translations.english_hilali_khan: For the living and the dead?
translations.english_rwwad: for the living and the dead,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا
phonetic: 77.27 Wa Ja`alnā Fīhā Rawāsiya Shāmikhātin Wa 'Asqaynākum Mā'an Furātāan

translations.english_saheeh: And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And have placed therein firm, and tall mountains, and have given you to drink sweet water?
translations.english_rwwad: and placed therein firm towering mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said to the disbelievers): "Depart you to that which you used to deny!
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be told,] “Proceed to that [Fire] which you used to deny!

arabic_text: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Depart you to a shadow (of Hell-Fire smoke ascending) in three columns,
translations.english_rwwad: Proceed to the shadow [of smoke] ascending in three columns,

arabic_text: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ
phonetic: 77.31 Lā Žalīlin Wa Lā Yughnī Mina Al-Lahabi

translations.english_saheeh: [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Neither shady, nor of any use against the fierce flame of the Fire."
translations.english_rwwad: that provides neither shade nor protection from the flames.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, it (Hell) throws sparks (huge) as Al-Qasr (a fort or a huge log of wood),
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, it [Hell] throws up sparks as big as castles,

translations.english_saheeh: As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
translations.english_hilali_khan: As if they were yellow camels or bundles of ropes.
translations.english_rwwad: as if they were tawny camels.

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: This is a Day they will not speak,
translations.english_hilali_khan: That will be a Day when they shall not speak (during some part of it),
translations.english_rwwad: On that Day they won’t speak,

translations.english_saheeh: Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they will not be permitted to put forth any excuse.
translations.english_rwwad: nor will they be allowed to make excuses.

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

phonetic: 77.38 Hādhā Yawmu Al-Faşli Jama`nākum Wa Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That will be a Day of Decision! We have brought you and the men of old together!
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be told,] “This is the Day of Judgment: We have gathered you along with the earlier generations.

translations.english_saheeh: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So if you have a plot, use it against Me (Allâh جل جلاله)!
translations.english_rwwad: So if you have any scheme, then plot it against Me.”

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
translations.english_hilali_khan: shall be amidst shades and springs.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the righteous will be amid shades and springs

translations.english_saheeh: And fruits from whatever they desire,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And fruits, such as they desire.
translations.english_rwwad: and will have whatever fruit they desire.

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 77.43 Kulū Wa Ashrabū Hanī'āan Bimā Kuntum Ta`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Eat and drink comfortably for that which you used to do."
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully, as a reward for what you used to do.”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, thus We reward the Muhsinûn (good-doers. See V.2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We reward those who do good.

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (O you disbelievers)! Eat and enjoy yourselves (in this worldly life) for a little while. Verily, you are the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals).
translations.english_rwwad: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while; you are truly wicked.”

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ
phonetic: 77.48 Wa 'Idhā Qīla Lahumu Arka`ū Lā Yarka`ūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.77:48)
A) Narrated Anas bin Mâlik رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "I have been ordered to fight the people till they say: Lâ ilâha illallâh (none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh). And if they say so, perform As-Salât (the prayer) like our Salât (prayers), face our Qîblah and slaughter as we slaughter, then their blood and property will be sacred to us and we will not interfere with them except legally and their reckoning will be with Allâh."
Narrated Maimûn bin Siyâh that he asked Anas bin Mâlik, "O Abu Hamzah! What makes the life and property of a person sacred?" He replied, "Whoever says, Lâ ilâha illallâh (none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh), faces our Qîblah during the Salât (prayers), perform As-Salât (the prayer) like us, and eat our slaughtered animals then he is a Muslim and has got the same rights and obligations as other Muslims have." (Sahih Al Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No.387).
B) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "If the people knew (the reward for) pronouncing the Adhân and for standing in the first row (in congregational prayers) and found no other way to get that except by drawing lots they would draw lots, and if they knew (the reward of) the Zuhr prayer (in the early moments of its stated time) they would race for it (go early) and if they knew (the reward of) ‘Ishâ and Fajr (night and morning) prayers in congregation, they would come to offer them even if they had to crawl." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 1, Hadith No.589).

translations.english_saheeh: And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when it is said to them: "Bow down yourself (in prayer)!" They bow not down (offer not their prayers).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: When it is said to them, “Bow [in prayer]”, they do not bow.

translations.english_saheeh: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Woe that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

translations.english_saheeh: Then in what statement after it [i.e., the Qur’ān] will they believe?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then in what statement after this (the Qur’ân) will they believe?
translations.english_rwwad: In which message after this [Qur’an] will they believe?
